thread.title: Student nabbed over phishing scams in Isabela
thread.title_full: Student nabbed over phishing scams in Isabela

title: Student nabbed over phishing scams in Isabela
text:
Student nabbed over phishing scams in Isabela (philstar.com)   5:24pm The Information Technology student receives the search warrant served by the operatives of the Department of Justice and the National Bureau of Investigation. DOJ Released 
MANILA, Philippines â€“ A 22-year-old student suspected of emptying credit card accounts through phishing scams was arrested in Isabela on Friday. 
The suspect was identified as Christian Ian Salvador, an Information Technology student from Isabela State University. 
Salvador was apprehended by the joint forces of the Department of Justice-Office of Cybercrime and the National Bureau of Investigation-Cyber Crimes Division on Friday morning in his residence in Barangay San Fermin, Cauayan, Isabela. 
The authorities said Salvador reportedly carried out the phishing scams through emails. 
His modus involves sending emails to credit card account holders containing a link for the user to verify or update accounts. Failure to do so may result in account suspension, his emails read. 
Victims are then led to a website with official-looking logo of a reputable bank wherein they are asked to input personal and financial information, including user ID, passwords, and account and personal identification numbers.   
The said website was later on found to be fake. 
Based on report, Salvador used the information obtained to purchase items under the name and account of his victims. 
The suspect will face charges for violation of Republic Act 10175 or the Cybercrime Prevention Act of 2012.
